[How to Play Klondike Solitaire]
The opening table is composed of stock, waste pile, 4 foundation piles and 7 tableau columns.

Klondike Solitaire games uses a standard 52 card deck of playing cards without jokers. The objective of the card game is to expose all cards and move them into foundation piles. These piles are built upward in suit from Aces to Kings.

Tableau columns are built downward (in decreasing rank, from Kings to Aces) in alternating colors (red, black). Any empty column can only be filled with a King or a pile of cards with a King at the top. Partial or complete piles can be moved from one column to another if they are built down by alternate colors and decreasing rank. Expose face-down cards in the tableau to find cards you need.

Tap the stock to move 1 or 3 card(s) to the waste. You can move the top card from the waste pile to any legal location in the foundation piles or tableau columns. If the stock runs out, tap its outline to deal again.
